intro: Stenopadus campestris, commonly known as the field stenopadus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
